summary: Email chain from November 2021 discussing research into potential defense witnesses for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The correspondence involves prosecutors and law enforcement personnel coordinating efforts to investigate individuals on a witness list, including checking visitor logs and social media.

persons.name: Lara Pomerantz
persons.context: Prosecutor in the Southern District of New York involved in the Maxwell case, copied on email about potential defense witnesses.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Prosecutor in the Southern District of New York copied on email about potential defense witnesses.

persons.name: Andrew
persons.context: Sender of an email checking on the progress of research into potential defense witnesses, likely part of the NYPD/FBI task force.

connections.description: Both are Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York working on the Maxwell case, copied together on the same email.

events.title: Email coordination on witness research
events.description: Email chain discusses ongoing research into potential defense witnesses for Ghislaine Maxwell's trial, including checking visitor logs and social media.

events.title: Potential defense witness list provided
events.description: A list of potential defense witnesses was provided to law enforcement for research, with instructions not to contact them directly.

keyFacts: Prosecutors and law enforcement were actively researching potential defense witnesses for Ghislaine Maxwell's trial as of November 2021.
Research methods included checking social media, phone numbers, and Maxwell's jail visitor logs to identify individuals.
The email chain shows coordination between the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
Instructions were given not to contact the potential witnesses directly during the research phase.
